DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study develop evaluate school-based HIV , STD , pregnancy prevention program 7th 8th grade middle school student use randomized-controlled intervention trial . The intervention program consist classroom-based curriculum interactive CD-ROM . Ten middle school recruit participate intervention trial . Five middle school randomize intervention group ; five middle school randomize control group . The study also develop model obtain community support development HIV , STD pregnancy prevention program middle school youth . The primary hypothesis test : Students attend middle school receive multi-component HIV , STD , pregnancy prevention intervention postpone sexual activity reduce level current sexual activity relative comparison condition . The major dependent variable proportion student sexually active , proportion initiate sexual intercourse . Intentions engage sexual activity , number time unprotected sexual intercourse , number sexual partner also examine . Secondary hypothesis examine effect multi-component HIV , STD , pregnancy prevention intervention student 's knowledge , self-efficacy , attitude , perceive norm , barrier , communication parent . The specific aim project : 1 . Develop model obtain community-based support HIV , STD , pregnancy prevention intervention middle school student . 2 . Adapt test , school-based , HIV , STD , pregnancy prevention curriculum middle school student use qualitative data target population , parent , community representative . 3 . Develop interactive CD-ROM-based tailor HIV , STD pregnancy prevention intervention provide individualize learning opportunity middle school student . 4 . Evaluate effect multi-component intervention ( classroom curriculum CD-ROM intervention ) sexual behavior outcome ( proportion student initiate sexual intercourse , proportion currently sexually active student unprotected sexual intercourse , number sexual partner , intention sexual intercourse ) among middle school student . 5 . Evaluate effect multi-component intervention student impact variable knowledge , self-efficacy , attitude , barrier , perceive norm related sexual risk-taking behavior academic achievement among middle school student . 6 . Disseminate finding scientific community , school district , community agency .
